page.title: 08CENTRAL OFFICES IN EPPING
page.content: Travelling is tiring and time- consuming if you're an officer of {Epping Forest District Council}in 1985.There are council offices in Loughton,Epping,and Waltham Abbey,and depots in other places.Plans to {centralise}in Epping were refused by the Secretary of State in 1982. This year,as a result of an architectural competition,plans have been drawn up to expand offices and centralise in Epping.Some residents in Epping are objecting to the bulky building and have complained. {Objections}centre on possible traffic jams and congestion on the B1393.The major advantage of having one central office is in bringing all the Council employees together under one roof.The new offices would mean easier {communication}between the people who work there and the people they serve.
